intro: Freyera cretica, commonly known as the Canary Islands freyera, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range in color from purple to pink. Freyera cretica is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
